biz.gabrys.lesscss.compiler2

Class NativeLessCompilerOptionsBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • biz.gabrys.lesscss.compiler2.NativeLessCompilerOptionsBuilder

  • public class NativeLessCompilerOptionsBuilder
extends Object
    Responsible for creating options that control the NativeLessCompiler compilation process.
    Since:
    2.0.0
    See Also:
    Less options

      • withIncludePaths

        public NativeLessCompilerOptionsBuilder withIncludePaths(List<String> includePaths)
        Sets available include paths (default: empty collection). If the file in an @import rule does not exist at that exact location, less will look for it at the location(s) passed to this option. You might use this for instance to specify a path to a library which you want to be referenced simply and relatively in the less files.
        Parameters:
        includePaths - the available include paths.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • withLineNumbers

        public NativeLessCompilerOptionsBuilder withLineNumbers(NativeLessCompilerOptionsBuilder.LineNumbersValue lineNumbers)
        Sets whether a compiler should generate inline source-mapping (default: NativeLessCompilerOptionsBuilder.LineNumbersValue.DISABLED). This was the only option before browsers started supporting Source Maps.
        Parameters:
        lineNumbers - the line numbers value (null is treated as NativeLessCompilerOptionsBuilder.LineNumbersValue.DISABLED).
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:

      • withSourceMapDefault

        public NativeLessCompilerOptionsBuilder withSourceMapDefault(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether a compiler should generate a Source Map file with a default name equal to output file name plus .map suffix. It does not matter whether you call this method before or after the withOutputFile(File) method.

        This method clears bulider's data set by the withSourceMapFile(File) and the withSourceMapInline(boolean) methods.

        Parameters:
        enabled - true whether the compiler should generate the Source Map file, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        withOutputFile(File), withSourceMapFile(File), withSourceMapInline(boolean)

        Returns:
        the command line option (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        withSourceMapDefault(boolean)

      • withSourceMapInline

        public NativeLessCompilerOptionsBuilder withSourceMapInline(boolean inline)
        Sets whether a compiler should generate a Source Map and put it to CSS code. This is not recommended for production, but for development it allows the compiler to produce a single output file which in browsers that support it, use the compiled CSS but show you the non-compiled Less source.

        This method clears bulider's data set by the withSourceMapDefault(boolean) and the withSourceMapFile(File) methods.

        Parameters:
        inline - true whether the compiler should generate a Source Map, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        withSourceMapDefault(boolean), withSourceMapFile(File), withSourceMapLessInline(boolean)

      • getSourceMapInlineCompilerOptions

        protected String[] getSourceMapInlineCompilerOptions()
        Returns a command line options which enables/disables generating a Source Map which will be put to CSS code.
        Returns:
        the command line options (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        withSourceMapInline(boolean)

      • withSourceMapLessInline

        public NativeLessCompilerOptionsBuilder withSourceMapLessInline(boolean inline)
        Sets whether a compiler should include all of the Less files in to the Source Map. This means that you only need your map file to get to your original source.

        This can be used in conjunction with the map inline option so that you do not need to have any additional external files at all.

        Parameters:
        inline - true whether the compiler should include all of the Less files in to the Source Map, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        withSourceMapInline(boolean)

      • getSourceMapLessInlineCompilerOption

        protected String getSourceMapLessInlineCompilerOption()

        Returns:
        the command line options (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        withSourceMapLessInline(boolean)

      • withSourceMapRootPath

        public NativeLessCompilerOptionsBuilder withSourceMapRootPath(String rootPath)
        Sets a path that will be prepended to each of the Less file paths inside the Source Map and also to the path to the map file specified in your output CSS.

        Use it if for instance you have a CSS file generated in the root on your web server but have your source less/css/map files in a different folder.

        Example: if you have a follow file structure: 

         output.css
 dev-files/output.css.map
 dev-files/output.less

        then you should set the Source Map root path to dev-files/.

        This option is the opposite of the Source Map base path option.

        Parameters:
        rootPath - the path which will be added.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        withSourceMapBasePath(String), withSourceMapUrl(String)

      • getSourceMapRootPathCompilerOption

        protected String getSourceMapRootPathCompilerOption()
        Returns a command line option representation of the Source Map root path.
        Returns:
        the command line option (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        withSourceMapRootPath(String)

      • withSourceMapBasePath

        public NativeLessCompilerOptionsBuilder withSourceMapBasePath(String basePath)
        Sets a path that will be removed from each of the Less file paths inside the Source Map and also from the path to the map file specified in your output CSS.

        It specifies a path which should be removed from the output paths. For instance if you are compiling a file in the less-files directory but the source files will be available on your web server in the root or current directory, you can specify this to remove the additional less-files part of the path.

        This option is the opposite of the Source Map root path option.

        Parameters:
        basePath - the path which will be removed.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        withSourceMapRootPath(String), withSourceMapUrl(String)

      • getSourceMapBasePathCompilerOption

        protected String getSourceMapBasePathCompilerOption()
        Returns a command line option representation of the Source Map base path.
        Returns:
        the command line option (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        withSourceMapBasePath(String)

      • withSourceMapUrl

        public NativeLessCompilerOptionsBuilder withSourceMapUrl(String url)
        Sets a path which will overwrite the URL in the CSS that points at the Source Map map file. This is for cases when the root path and the base path options are not producing exactly what you need.
        Parameters:
        url - the Source Map URL.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        withSourceMapBasePath(String), withSourceMapRootPath(String)

        the command line option (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:

      • withRootPath

        public NativeLessCompilerOptionsBuilder withRootPath(String rootPath)
        Sets a path which will be added to every generated import and URL in CSS code (default: null). This does not affect less import statements that are processed, just ones that are left in the output CSS.

        For instance, if all the images the CSS use are in a folder called resources, you can use this option to add this on to the URL's and then have the name of that folder configurable.

        Parameters:
        rootPath - the path which will be added.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • getRootPathCompilerOption

        protected String getRootPathCompilerOption()
        Returns a command line option representation of the root path.
        Returns:
        the command line option (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        withRootPath(String)

      • withRelativeUrls

        public NativeLessCompilerOptionsBuilder withRelativeUrls(boolean relativeUrls)
        Sets whether the compiler should rewrite relative URLs (default: false). By default URLs are kept as-is, so if you import a file in a sub-directory that references an image, exactly the same URL will be output in the CSS code. This option allows you to re-write URLs in imported files so that the URL is always relative to the base imported file. Example: 
         # main.less
 @import "files/backgrounds.less";
 
 # files/backgrounds.less
 .icon-1 {
     background-image: url('images/lamp-post.png');
 }

        this will output the following normally 

         .icon-1 {
     background-image: url('images/lamp-post.png');
 }

        but with this option on it will instead output 

         .icon-1 {
     background-image: url('files/images/lamp-post.png');
 }

        You may also want to consider using the data-uri function instead of this option, which will embed images into the CSS.

        Parameters:
        relativeUrls - true whether the compiler should rewrite relative URLs, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • getRelativeUrlsCompilerOption

        protected String getRelativeUrlsCompilerOption()
        Returns a command line option which enables/disables rewriting relative URLs.
        Returns:
        the command line option (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        withRelativeUrls(boolean)

      • withStrictMath

        public NativeLessCompilerOptionsBuilder withStrictMath(boolean strictMath)
        Sets whether a compiler should try and process all maths in Less code (default: false). Without this option on Less will try and process all maths in your Less e.g.: 
         .class {
     height: calc(100% - 10px);
 }

        will be processed currently.

        With strict math on, only maths that is inside unnecessary parenthesis will be processed. For instance. 

         .class {
     width: calc(100% - ((10px  - 5px)));
     height: (100px / 4px);
     font-size: 1 / 4;
 }
 
         .class {
     width: calc(100% - 5px);
     height: 25px;
     font-size: 1 / 4;
 }
        Parameters:
        strictMath - true whether the compiler should try and process all maths in the Less code, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • getStrictMathCompilerOption

        protected String getStrictMathCompilerOption()
        Returns a command line option which enables/disables strict math.
        Returns:
        the command line option (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        withStrictMath(boolean)

      • withStrictUnits

        public NativeLessCompilerOptionsBuilder withStrictUnits(boolean strictUnits)
        Sets whether the compiler should guess units in Less code when it does maths (default: false). Without this option, Less compiler attempts to guess at the output unit when it does maths. For instance 
         .class {
     property: 1px * 2px;
 }

        In this case, things are clearly not right - a length multiplied by a length gives an area, but CSS does not support specifying areas. So we assume that the user meant for one of the values to be a value, not a unit of length and Less outputs 2px. With strict units on, Less assumes this is a bug in the calculation and throw an error.

        Parameters:
        strictUnits - true whether the compiler should guess units in the Less code when it does maths, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • getStrictUnitsCompilerOption

        protected String getStrictUnitsCompilerOption()
        Returns a command line option which enables/disables strict units.
        Returns:
        the command line option (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        withStrictUnits(boolean)

      • create

        public Collection<Object> create()
        Creates a collection with configuration options for the NativeLessCompiler compilation process.
        Returns:
        the collection with configuration options.
        Throws:
        BuilderCreationException - if you set an output file without setting an input file.
        Since:
        2.0.0
